instructions.name: borrow
docs: This function is used to initiate borrow of regular spl tokens (eg.: WSOL, WIF) or native SOL.
# Arguments
* `ctx` - accounts associated with this instruction
* `amount` - The amount of native tokens to repay

accounts.name: vault_config
docs: Needs to be mut as it stores SOL

accounts.name: mint
docs: This is the token that user will deposit/borrow

accounts.name: wormhole_bridge
docs: Wormhole bridge data. Mutable.

accounts.name: custom_wormhole_emitter
docs: This is our custom emitter account that will be used to send raw payload across wormhole core bridge

accounts.name: custom_emitter_wormhole_sequence
docs: This is not created until the first message is posted, so it needs to be an [UncheckedAccount]
for wormhole_program (core bridge) to be able to create it. [`wormhole::post_message`] requires this account be mutable.
Notice: this account belongs to wormhole_program who will increment seq for it
and will use to generate seq number for a message (not signed VAA)

accounts.name: wormhole_message
docs: Note: Must be our program PDA as this account is required to be CPI call signer.
Note: As seed sequence we are passing `user_message_nonce.value`.
It ensures that there will never be two messages with the same address at any point in time.
Because each message has user/sender.key() and user nonce in seed which makes it unique.
This prevents conflicts between transactions using the same `wormhole_message` account addresses.

instructions.name: deposit
docs: This function is used to deposit regular spl tokens (eg.: JitoSOL, USDC) or native SOL
# Arguments
* `ctx` - accounts associated with this instruction
* `amount` - The amount of native tokens to deposit as collateral.

accounts.name: vault_config
docs: Needs to be mut as it stores SOL

accounts.name: mint
docs: This is the token that user will deposit/borrow

accounts.name: wormhole_bridge
docs: Wormhole bridge data. Mutable.

accounts.name: custom_wormhole_emitter
docs: This is our custom emitter account that will be used to send raw payload across wormhole core bridge

accounts.name: custom_emitter_wormhole_sequence
docs: This is not created until the first message is posted, so it needs to be an [UncheckedAccount]

It ensures that there will never be two messages with the same address at any point in time.

accounts.name: custom_wormhole_emitter
docs: If we would use `init` we could blow up the stack (we are already creating like that other pda accounts)
Anchor is not memory efficient with using `init` to create accounts.
issue: https://github.com/anza-xyz/agave/issues/1186

instructions.name: pair_account
docs: This will send a Vaa with paring request to Hub.
We request pairing sender account with given user_id

accounts.name: vault_config
docs: Needs to be mut as it stores SOL

accounts.name: mint
docs: This is the token that user will deposit/borrow

accounts.name: wormhole_bridge
docs: Wormhole bridge data. Mutable.

accounts.name: custom_wormhole_emitter

instructions.name: release_funds
docs: This function will release funds to user.
This function is called by third part relayer app
# Arguments
* `ctx` - accounts associated with this instruction
* _delivery_instruction_vaa_hash - is used in instruction constraints, its delivery instruction vaa body hash

accounts.name: vault_config
docs: Needs to be mut as it stores SOL that can be withdrawn

accounts.name: mint
docs: This is the token mint that will be withdrawn/borrowed

accounts.name: recipient
docs: Mut in case we will receive native SOL (that it will go directly to wallet not ATA)

accounts.name: consumed_nonce
docs: program will create this account in handler.

instructions.name: repay
docs: This function is used repay debt with regular spl tokens (eg.: JitoSOL, USDC) or native SOL.
# Arguments
* `ctx` - accounts associated with this instruction
* `amount` - The amount of native tokens to repay

accounts.name: vault_config
docs: Needs to be mut as it stores SOL

accounts.name: mint
docs: This is the token that user will deposit/borrow

instructions.name: withdraw
docs: This function is used to initiate a withdrawal of regular spl tokens (eg.: WSOL, WIF)
or native SOL - not wormhole wrapped tokens.
# Arguments
* `ctx` - accounts associated with this instruction
* `amount` - The amount of native tokens to repay

errors.name: InvalidHubChainId
errors.msg: Hub chain id can not be 1

errors.name: InvalidTokenBridgeForeignEndpoint
errors.msg: Foreign endpoint different than registered one

errors.name: RedeemedAmountMismatch
errors.msg: Expected vaa amount different than redeemed

errors.name: NotEnoughTokensInCustody
errors.msg: Not enough tokens in custody to redeem

errors.name: MintNotEqualToTokenMintInVaa
errors.msg: Mint must match the mint in VAA msg

errors.name: NotRelayerRewardAccount
errors.msg: Not a registered relayer reward account

errors.name: NotRelayerVaultAccount
errors.msg: Not a registered relayer vault account

errors.name: VaaInvalidForeignContractAddress
errors.msg: Vaa: invalid foreign wormhole tunnel address

fields.name: owner
docs: Program's owner.

fields.name: paused
docs: Boolean indicating whether contract is paused

fields.name: hub_chain_id
docs: Hub chain Id. Cannot equal `1` (Solana's Chain ID).

fields.name: hub_address
docs: Contract address of the hub. Cannot be zero address.

fields.name: relayer_reward
docs: reward for relayer for tx relaying the tx to other chain

fields.name: relayer_account
docs: Relayer EOA that can invoke redeem functions

fields.name: relayer_reward_account
docs: Account where relayer rewards are sent

fields.name: relayer_vault
docs: Account where hub delivery payments are sent

fields.name: price_keeper
docs: Account EOA that can update delivery prices

fields.name: guardian_set_expiration_time
docs: Period for how long a guardian set is valid after it has been replaced by a new one.  This
guarantees that VAAs issued by that set can still be submitted for a certain period.  In
this period we still trust the old guardian set.

fields.name: fee
docs: Amount of lamports that needs to be paid to the protocol to post a message

fields.name: guardian_set_index
docs: The current guardian set index, used to decide which signature sets to accept.

fields.name: last_lamports
docs: Lamports in the collection account

fields.name: config
docs: Bridge configuration, which is set once upon initialization.

types.name: CustomWormholeEmitter
docs: This is the pda account that we need for Wormhole Core Bridge
It wil be used as emitter account during sending messages with raw core bridge (without token_bridge)
It does not need to have any data

types.name: DeliveryPriceConfig
docs: Delivery Price Config
This account holds the configuration for delivery prices between spoke and hub
# Fields
* `spoke_release_funds_tx_cost_sol` - cost in SOL(lamports) for spoke release_funds tx
* `hub_tx_cost_sol` - cost in SOL(lamports)  for hub tx
* `max_delay_between_updates` - maximum delay between updates in seconds
* `last_update_timestamp` - timestamp of last update in seconds

types.name: UserMessageNonce
docs: User message nonce
This struct is used in two cases:
1. Spoke <-> It ensures that no replayed responses from the Hub will be processed.
2. As a seed to the `wormhole_message` account: It ensures that there will never be two messages with the
same address (and nonce) at any point in time. This prevents conflicts between transactions using the same
`wormhole_message` account addresses (avoiding race conditions).
Previously, the `spoke_message_sequence` provided this functionality and also kept track of the message count.
However, since there will no longer be `token_bridge`/`cctp` messages, the message count is now derived from
the `custom_emitter_wormhole_sequence`

types.name: VaultConfig
docs: Vault config pda account is used as owner for ATA accounts of tokens deposited to into Spoke
